name: cloudinary
description: Cloudinary Model Context Protocol Server to upload media to Cloudinary and get back the media link and details.

tools.name: upload

file.description: Path to file, URL, or base64 data URI to upload

resource_type.description: Type of resource to upload. For videos, the upload will return a streaming response as it processes in chunks.

public_id.description: Public ID to assign to the uploaded asset. This will be used in the final URL. If not provided, Cloudinary will generate one.

overwrite.description: Whether to overwrite existing assets with the same public ID

tags.description: Tags to assign to the uploaded asset

prompts.name: Upload an Image
prompts.description: This example demonstrates how to upload an image to Cloudinary.
prompts.text: use_mcp_tool({ server_name: 'cloudinary', tool_name: 'upload', arguments: { file: 'path/to/image.jpg', resource_type: 'image', public_id: 'my-custom-id' }});

CLOUDINARY_API_KEY.description: Your Cloudinary API key, used to authenticate requests to the Cloudinary API.
CLOUDINARY_API_KEY.title: CLOUDINARY_API_KEY

CLOUDINARY_API_SECRET.description: Your Cloudinary API secret, used to authenticate requests and secure your Cloudinary account.
